name: Fall of Minas Ithil
description: Minas Ithil is captured by the Nazgûl and renamed Minas Morgul. The Palantír of the city is seized.

name: Eärnur becomes King
description: Eärnur becomes King of Gondor and is challenged to single combat by the Witch-king.

name: End of the Kings of Gondor
description: The challenge is repeated, Eärnur rides to Minas Morgul and never returns. Since he leaves no descendants, the kingship in Gondor ends and the Stewards take power, "until the king returns". Mardil I becomes first ruling Steward.

name: Gandalf goes to Dol Guldur
description: Gandalf decides to go to Dol Guldur. Sauron withdraws and hides in the east and the Watchful Peace begins.

name: Thorin I leaves Erebor
description: Thorin I leaves the Erebor and leads most of his people to the Grey Mountains.

name: Isumbras I becomes thirteenth Thain
description: Isumbras I becomes the thirteenth Thain of the Shire and the first from the Took family. The Buckland is settled by the Oldbucks.

name: Birth of Sméagol
description: Sméagol is born.

name: End of the Watchful Peace
description: Sauron returns to Dol Guldur stronger than before and the Watchful Peace comes to an end.

name: Finding of the One Ring
description: The White Council is formed. The One Ring is found by the Stoor Déagol, who is murdered by his friend Sméagol, who takes the Ring into his possession.

name: Sméagol becomes Gollum
description: Sméagol, later Gollum, hides in the Misty Mountains after being cast out by his kindred.

name: Sauron's attack on Gondor
description: Sauron's attack on Gondor, in which Osgiliath and the stone bridge over the Anduin are destroyed.

name: Orcs block all passes to Eriador
description: The Orcs of the Misty Mountains, which had again multiplied greatly in the years before, begin to block all passes to Eriador. Moria is populated by Sauron's creatures.

name: Celebrían attacked by Orcs
description: Elrond's wife Celebrían is attacked by Orcs on a journey to Lothlórien to her mother Galadriel on the Redhorn Pass and taken prisoner. She can be freed by her sons Elladan and Elrohir, but is tortured and bears a poisoned wound.

name: Battle of the Field of Celebrant
description: Celebrían sails west, although Elrond could heal her physically. Calenardhon is overrun by Orcs from the Misty Mountains and the Balchoth, who came from the northeast and had previously ravaged Rhovanion, traversed the Brown Lands and crossed the Anduin with rafts. Eorl the Young from the people of the Éothéod follows the call for help from Gondor's Steward Cirion, leads a great cavalry army southward, defeats them on the plain of Celebrant and saves the hemmed-in remnants of Gondor's northern army. The already largely depopulated Calenardhon since the Great Plague is left to his people and the kingdom of Rohan is founded, which is allied with Gondor. Eorl becomes the first King of the Mark of Rohan, for residence he takes a green hill at the foot of the White Mountains, on which the capital Edoras arises.

name: Nazgûl besiege Minas Ithil
description: The Nazgûl come out from Mordor and besiege the city of Minas Ithil.

name: Eärnur becomes King, first challenge
description: Eärnur becomes King of Gondor and is challenged to single combat by the Witch-king.

name: End of Gondor's kingship
description: The challenge is repeated, Eärnur rides to Minas Morgul and never returns. Since he leaves no descendants, the kingship in Gondor ends and the Stewards take power, 'until the king returns'. Mardil I becomes first ruling Steward.

name: Dol Guldur's power increases
description: Dol Guldur's power continues to increase. It is feared that Sauron might dwell there and is taking shape again.

name: Gandalf goes to Dol Guldur, Watchful Peace begins
description: Gandalf decides to go to Dol Guldur. Sauron withdraws and hides in the east and the Watchful Peace begins.

name: Thorin I moves to Grey Mountains
description: Thorin I leaves the Erebor and leads most of his people to the Grey Mountains.

name: First Took Thain, Buckland settled
description: Isumbras I becomes the thirteenth Thain of the Shire and the first from the Took family. The Buckland is settled by the Oldbucks.

name: Sméagol born
description: Sméagol is born.

name: Sauron returns, Watchful Peace ends
description: Sauron returns to Dol Guldur stronger than before and the Watchful Peace comes to an end.

name: White Council formed, Ring found
description: The White Council is formed. The One Ring is found by the Stoor Déagol, who is murdered by his friend Sméagol, who takes the Ring into his possession.

name: Gollum hides in Misty Mountains
description: Sméagol, later Gollum, hides in the Misty Mountains after being cast out by his kindred.

name: Sauron attacks Gondor, Osgiliath damaged
description: Sauron's attack on Gondor, in which Osgiliath and the stone bridge over the Anduin are destroyed.

name: Orcs multiply, passes blocked
description: The Orcs of the Misty Mountains, which had again multiplied greatly in the years before, begin to block all passes to Eriador. Moria is populated by Sauron's creatures.

name: Celebrían captured and tortured
description: Elrond's wife Celebrían is attacked by Orcs on a journey to Lothlórien to her mother Galadriel on the Redhorn Pass and taken prisoner. She can be freed by her sons Elladan and Elrohir, but is tortured and bears a poisoned wound.

name: Death of Eorl
description: Eorl falls in a battle in the Wold in a renewed attack of the Balchoth, who are finally driven away in the following years by his son Brego.

name: Meduseld completed, Baldor's vow
description: The 'Golden Hall' Meduseld is completed by Brego. At the dedication his eldest son Baldor vows to enter the Paths of the Dead.

name: Baldor enters Paths of the Dead, dragons return
description: Brego's son Baldor enters the Paths of the Dead and remains missing. His father dies of grief. In the north dragons emerge again in the Grey Mountains and attack the Dwarves.

name: Dáin I killed by dragon
description: King Dáin I is killed by a dragon.

name: Return to Erebor and Iron Hills
description: Thrór returns with part of his people to the Erebor, his brother Grór goes to the Iron Hills.

name: First pipe-weed cultivation
description: Tobold Hornblower cultivates 'pipe-weed' in the Southfarthing as the first Hobbit.

name: Great Smials excavations begin
description: Isengrim II becomes tenth Thain and begins the excavations for the Great Smials, the dwellings of the Tooks.

name: White Tower renewed
description: Ecthelion I renews the White Tower in Minas Tirith.

name: Orcs invade Eriador again
description: Orcs begin to invade Eriador again.

name: Battle of Greenfields
description: An Orc-band is defeated by Bandobras Took in the Northfarthing in the Battle of Greenfields.

name: War of Rohan and the Long Winter
description: Rohan is attacked from two sides: invaders from the east and Dunlendings from the west who had conquered Isengard. Gondor cannot help as it faces three Corsair fleets. Corsairs land at Lefnui and Isen mouths to support the Dunlendings. King Helm Hammerhand is driven from the Isen Fords with great losses and besieged at Hornburg. Edoras is captured and Wulf, son of Freca whom Helm had slain, proclaims himself king. The Long Winter compounds the misery.

name: End of Long Winter, Fréaláf becomes king
description: Helm and his two sons perish during the siege. When winter abates, Fréaláf pushes down from Dunharrow, reconquers Edoras and slays Wulf. Snowmelt floods force eastern invaders to retreat. Dunlendings are driven from Rohan and Isengard. Fréaláf becomes first King of the second line of Rohan. Isengard is given to Saruman's care to prevent renewed Dunlending occupation.

name: Smaug destroys Erebor and Dale
description: The dragon Smaug falls upon the Erebor and destroys the city of Dale. King Thrór escapes with his son Thráin and his grandson Thorin.

name: Thrór killed by Azog
description: Thrór is killed in Moria by the Orc Azog. The Dwarves gather for a war of revenge. Gerontius Took, later known as the Old Took, is born.

name: War of Dwarves and Orcs begins
description: The war between the Dwarves and the Orcs of the Misty Mountains begins.

name: Battle of Azanulbizar
description: The great Battle of Azanulbizar takes place before the East-gate of Moria, in which the Dwarves carry off the victory and Azog is killed by Dáin, but they also suffer heavy losses. Thráin II and his son Thorin wander westward and settle at the foot of the Blue Mountains, Dáin returns to the Iron Hills.

name: Orc incursions plague Rohan
description: Rohan is plagued by constant incursions of Orcs from the north.

name: Thráin II sets out for Erebor
description: Thráin II sets out on the way to the Erebor and is pursued by Sauron's servants.

name: Thráin II imprisoned in Dol Guldur
description: Thráin II is imprisoned in Dol Guldur, the last of the Dwarf-rings is taken from him.

name: Gandalf finds Thráin in Dol Guldur
description: Gandalf penetrates Dol Guldur for the second time and recognizes that Sauron actually dwells in this place. He finds Thráin, who hands him the key to the Erebor and dies shortly thereafter.

name: White Council meets, Saruman opposes attack
description: The White Council meets. Gandalf advises an attack on Dol Guldur, but Saruman prevents this. He begins the search himself on the Gladden Fields, where Isildur fell.

name: White Tree withers again
description: Steward Belecthor II of Gondor dies. The White Tree withers again, this time no sapling is to be found and the dead tree is left standing.

name: Haradrim attack Gondor
description: The Haradrim, incited by Sauron's emissaries, cross the river Poros and attack Gondor. The two elder sons of Folcwine, King of Rohan, who had hurried to Gondor's aid, fall in a battle.

name: Bilbo Baggins born
description: Bilbo Baggins is born in the Shire.

name: Ithilien abandoned, Henneth Annûn established
description: Ithilien is abandoned by its inhabitants due to the raids of the Uruks, the great fighting Orcs from Mordor. The secret stronghold Henneth Annûn is established.

name: Gilraen born
description: Aragorn's mother Gilraen is born.

name: The Fell Winter
description: In the Fell Winter the Baranduin and other rivers freeze and white wolves penetrate into Eriador.

name: Floods devastate western lands
description: Enedwaith and Minhiriath are devastated by floods caused by the snowmelt. The city of Tharbad is destroyed and abandoned.

name: Old Took dies
description: The Old Took dies.

name: Arathorn marries Gilraen
description: Arathorn, son of the Dúnedain chieftain Arador, marries Gilraen.

name: Arador killed, Arathorn II becomes chieftain
description: Arador is slain by Trolls, Arathorn II becomes new chieftain. Denethor II, son of Steward Ecthelion II, is born in Minas Tirith.

name: Aragorn born
description: Aragorn, Arathorn's son, is born.

name: Arathorn II killed, Aragorn taken to Rivendell
description: Arathorn II is killed by an Orc-arrow and Gilraen goes with Aragorn to Imladris, where he is adopted by Elrond as foster-son. He is given the name Estel (Hope), his lineage is concealed from him.

name: Saruman discovers Sauron's search
description: Saruman discovers that Sauron's servants are searching the Gladden Fields, which suggests that Sauron knows where Isildur fell. He is concerned but does not inform the White Council.

name: Quest of Erebor, Battle of Five Armies
description: Thorin Oakenshield and Gandalf visit Bilbo Baggins, who participates as 'master-thief' in the journey to Erebor. Bilbo encounters Gollum and finds the Master Ring. The White Council meets and Saruman votes for attack on Dol Guldur to prevent Sauron's search. Sauron abandons Dol Guldur. After Smaug's death by Bard of Esgaroth the Battle of Five Armies takes place, in which Thorin and his nephews Kíli and Fíli die. Dáin II Ironfoot becomes new King under the Mountain.

name: Bilbo returns, Sauron returns to Mordor
description: Bilbo Baggins returns to the Shire with the One Ring. Sauron secretly returns to Mordor.

name: Bard rebuilds Dale, Gollum begins search
description: Bard rebuilds Dale and becomes king. Gollum leaves the Misty Mountains to search for the 'thief' of his ring.

name: Théoden born
description: Théoden, son of King Thengel of Rohan, is born.

name: Gandalf and Balin visit Bilbo
description: Gandalf and Balin visit Bilbo Baggins in the Shire.

name: Finduilas born
description: Finduilas, daughter of Adrahil of Dol Amroth, is born.

name: Sauron reveals himself, begins Barad-dûr reconstruction
description: Sauron reveals himself definitively and strengthens his power in Mordor. He begins the reconstruction of Barad-dûr. Gollum sets out on the way to Mordor. Dol Guldur is again taken possession of by three Nazgûl.

name: Last White Council meeting, Saruman takes Isengard
description: The White Council meets for the last time. Saruman claims that he has learned that the Master Ring has been washed down the Anduin into the sea. He withdraws to Isengard, takes it into his possession and fortifies it. Through spies he has himself informed of all Gandalf's steps and notices his interest in the Shire.

name: Mount Doom fires again
description: Mount Doom spits fire again and Ithilien's last inhabitants leave the land.

name: Aragorn meets Gandalf
description: Aragorn encounters Gandalf and befriends him.

name: Aragorn's great journeys as Thorongil
description: Aragorn undertakes his great journeys and serves under the name Thorongil both Thengel, King of Rohan, as well as Ecthelion II, Steward of Gondor.

name: Frodo Baggins born
description: Frodo Baggins is born.

name: Denethor marries Finduilas
description: Denethor marries Finduilas of Dol Amroth.

name: Bain becomes King of Dale
description: Bain, Bard's son, becomes King of Dale.

name: Boromir and Théodred born
description: Boromir, Denethor's son, is born. Théodred, Théoden's son, is born.

name: Aragorn and Arwen betrothal, Théoden becomes king
description: Aragorn enters Lothlórien and meets Arwen again. He gives her Barahir's Ring and the couple become betrothed on Cerin Amroth. In the same year Gollum meets Shelob at the border of Mordor and Théoden becomes King of Rohan. Samwise Gamgee sees the light of the world in the Shire.

name: Meriadoc Brandybuck born
description: Meriadoc Brandybuck is born.

name: Faramir born
description: Faramir, Denethor's second son, is born.

name: Denethor II becomes Steward
description: Steward Ecthelion II of Gondor dies, his son Denethor II becomes his successor.

name: Finduilas dies
description: Finduilas, Denethor's wife, dies young.

name: Balin sets out for Moria
description: Balin sets out from the Erebor to Moria.

name: Peregrin Took born
description: Peregrin Took is born.

name: Éomer born
description: Éomer, Éomund's son, is born.

name: Balin dies, Moria settlement destroyed
description: Balin dies, the Dwarves' settlement in Moria is destroyed.

name: Éowyn born
description: Éowyn, Éomer's sister, is born.

name: Saruman uses Orthanc Palantír, becomes traitor
description: Saruman uses the Palantír of Orthanc and is deceived by Sauron, who is in possession of the Stone of Minas Ithil. He finally becomes a traitor. From his spies he learns that the Rangers of the North sharply guard the Shire.

name: Bilbo's farewell party
description: Bilbo Baggins celebrates a great party on the occasion of his 'eleventy-first' (111th) birthday, at which he suddenly disappears to the surprise of the guests present thanks to his ring, to turn his back on the Shire and go wandering once more. Frodo becomes the new master of Bag End. Gandalf suspects that Bilbo's ring could be the One Ring, the watches around the Shire are doubled. He begins to search for Gollum and asks Aragorn for his help.

name: Bilbo settles in Rivendell
description: Bilbo settles in Rivendell.

name: Gandalf visits Frodo regularly
description: Gandalf visits Frodo in Bag End and also comes by from time to time in the next four years.

name: Brand becomes King of Dale, Gilraen dies
description: Brand, Bain's son, becomes new King in Dale. Aragorn's mother Gilraen dies.

name: Gandalf's last visit to Frodo for years
description: In autumn Gandalf visits Frodo for the last time for now.

name: Hunt for Gollum, Arwen returns to Rivendell
description: Gandalf and Aragorn occasionally hunt for Gollum again in the course of the next eight years in the Anduin vales, in Mirkwood and in Rhovanion up to the borders of Mordor. Sometime during this time Gollum dares to go into Mordor and is taken captive. Since the Misty Mountains and Wilderland become ever more dangerous and unsafe, Elrond sends for Arwen, who still lives in Lórien with her grandmother Galadriel, and she returns to Rivendell.

name: Gollum captured by Aragorn, Gandalf reads Isildur's scroll
description: Gollum is released from Mordor and a little later picked up by Aragorn in the Dead Marshes. He brings him to King Thranduil in Mirkwood, where he is guarded by the Wood-elves. Gandalf visits Minas Tirith and reads Isildur's scroll.

name: Gandalf arrives in Hobbiton
description: Gandalf comes to Hobbiton.

name: The Shadow of the Past
description: The Shadow of the Past. Gandalf tells Frodo the history of the Ring. He makes sure that Frodo's ring is the One. Sam becomes a confidant.

name: Gandalf prepares Frodo
description: Gandalf remains in the Shire and prepares Frodo for his mission. At the end of June he departs for the south, but wants to be back by Frodo's birthday at the latest.

name: Attack on Osgiliath, Gollum escapes
description: Sauron attacks Osgiliath; Thranduil is also attacked, and Gollum can escape.

name: Boromir sets out for Rivendell
description: Boromir sets out from Minas Tirith on the way to Imladris.

name: Gandalf imprisoned in Orthanc
description: Gandalf comes to Isengard and is imprisoned in Orthanc.

name: Gollum loses traces, Frodo sells Bag End
description: All traces of Gollum are lost. It is believed that at this time, since he is hunted both by the Elves and by Sauron's servants, he sought refuge in Moria; but when he finally discovered the way to the West-gate, he could not get out. Frodo sells Bag End to Lobelia.

name: Gandalf escapes Orthanc
description: In the early morning hours Gandalf escapes from Orthanc. The Nazgûl cross the Fords of Isen.

name: Gandalf refused at Edoras
description: Gandalf comes as a beggar to Edoras; he is refused entry.

name: Gandalf gains entry to Edoras
description: Gandalf gains admittance to Edoras. Théoden commands him to leave: 'Take any horse, but be gone before tomorrow!'

name: Gandalf encounters Shadowfax
description: Gandalf encounters Shadowfax, but the animal will not let him approach. He follows Shadowfax over the plain. In the Shire Frodo waits in vain for Gandalf.

name: Nazgûl reach Sarn Ford
description: In the evening the Nazgûl reach the Sarn Ford and drive away the watch of the Rangers of the North. Gandalf catches up with Shadowfax. Frodo's birthday.

name: Four Nazgûl reach Shire
description: Four Nazgûl reach the Shire before dawn. The others pursue the Rangers eastward and then come back to watch the Greenway. In the morning Merry and Dick Bolger depart with a cart for Crickhollow. In the evening Frodo, Sam and Pippin leave Bag End. A Black Rider comes to Hobbiton at nightfall. Gandalf has tamed Shadowfax and rides from Rohan.

name: Hobbits encounter Black Rider
description: Frodo, Sam and Pippin encounter a Black Rider but remain undetected. In the evening they meet Elves and spend the night under their protection. Gandalf crosses the Isen.

name: Ferry escape from Nazgûl
description: The Hobbits come to Farmer Maggot and meet Merry. At the ferry they escape a Nazgûl and reach Crickhollow in the evening.

name: Old Forest, Tom Bombadil
description: The Hobbits get lost in the Old Forest and meet Tom Bombadil. He saves them from Old Man Willow and they spend the night in his house.

name: Second night with Tom Bombadil
description: Second overnight stay of the Hobbits with Tom Bombadil. Gandalf crosses the Greyflood.

name: Barrow-wight encounter
description: The Hobbits are captured by a Barrow-wight on the Barrow-downs and again saved by Bombadil. Gandalf reaches Sarn Ford.

name: Arrival in Bree
description: The Hobbits come to Bree late in the evening. Gandalf reaches the Shire and visits the Gaffer.

name: Black Rider raids, meeting Aragorn
description: Crickhollow and the inn in Bree are raided by Black Riders in the early morning hours. The Hobbits leave Bree with Aragorn. Gandalf comes to Crickhollow, rides on and reaches Bree at night.

name: Gandalf searches for Frodo
description: Gandalf leaves Bree to find Frodo.

name: Attack on Weathertop
description: He is attacked at night on the summit of Weathertop. From their camp at the Midgewater Marshes Frodo and Aragorn observe flashes of light in the eastern sky.

name: Frodo wounded at Weathertop
description: Aragorn and the Hobbits reach Weathertop and camp at the northern foot. At night they are attacked by 5 Nazgûl and Frodo is wounded.

name: Glorfindel leaves Rivendell
description: Glorfindel leaves Imladris.

name: Glorfindel drives off Black Riders
description: He drives three Black Riders from the Bridge of Mitheithel.

name: Crossing the bridge
description: Aragorn and the Hobbits cross the bridge.

name: Glorfindel meets Hobbits
description: Glorfindel meets the Hobbits at dusk. Gandalf reaches Rivendell.

name: Flight over Ford of Bruinen
description: Flight over the Ford of Bruinen. The Nazgûl are swept away by a flood wave.

name: Frodo awakens, Boromir arrives
description: Frodo awakens in Elrond's house. Boromir arrives in Imladris at night.

name: Council of Elrond
description: The Council of Elrond.

name: Fellowship departs Rivendell
description: At dusk the nine companions depart from Imladris.

name: Fellowship reaches Hollin
description: The companions reach Hollin.

name: Snowstorm on Redhorn Pass
description: Snowstorm on the Redhorn Pass.

name: Wolf attack, reach West-gate of Moria
description: Wolf attack at dawn. At nightfall the companions reach the West-gate of Moria. Gollum begins following the Ring-bearer.

name: Night in Twenty-first Hall
description: Night in the Twenty-first Hall.

name: Bridge of Khazad-dûm, Gandalf's fall
description: The Bridge of Khazad-dûm and Gandalf's fall. Late at night the companions reach the River Nimrodel.

name: Arrival in Caras Galadhon
description: Arrival of the companions in Caras Galadhon in the evening hours.

name: Gandalf pursues Balrog to Zirakzigil
description: Gandalf pursues the Balrog to the peak of Zirakzigil.

name: Gandalf casts down Balrog and dies
description: He casts down the Balrog and dies. His body lies on the Silvertine.

name: Galadriel's Mirror, Gandalf returns to life
description: Galadriel's Mirror. Gandalf returns to life but remains unconscious.

name: Farewell to Lórien
description: Farewell to Lórien. From his hiding place on the west bank of the Anduin Gollum watches the departure.

name: Gwaihir carries Gandalf to Lórien
description: Gwaihir carries Gandalf to Lórien.

name: Boats attacked at Sarn Gebir
description: The boats are attacked at night near Sarn Gebir.

name: Argonath, First Battle at Isen Fords
description: The companions pass the Argonath and camp at Parth Galen. First Battle at the Fords of Isen; Théodred, Théoden's son, is slain.

name: Breaking of Fellowship
description: Breaking of the Fellowship. Boromir's death; his horn is heard in Minas Tirith. Meriadoc and Peregrin are captured by the Uruk-hai. Frodo and Samwise enter the eastern Emyn Muil. In the evening Aragorn takes up pursuit of the Orcs. Éomer receives news of the descent of the Orc-horde from the Emyn Muil.

name: Aragorn reaches Emyn Muil
description: Aragorn reaches the western edge of the Emyn Muil at sunrise. About midnight Éomer leaves Eastfold against Théoden's command to pursue the Orcs.

name: Éomer finds Orcs at Fangorn
description: Éomer finds the Orcs at the forest edge of Fangorn.

name: Hobbits escape, meet Treebeard
description: Meriadoc and Pippin escape and encounter Treebeard. At sunrise the Rohirrim attack and kill the Orcs. Frodo descends from the Emyn Muil and meets Gollum. Faramir sees the boat in which Boromir was laid to rest.

name: Entmoot begins, Éomer meets Aragorn
description: The Entmoot begins. On his way back to Edoras Éomer meets Aragorn.

name: Dead Marshes crossing, Gandalf the White
description: At dusk Frodo, Sam and Gollum begin crossing the Dead Marshes. The Entmoot continues. Aragorn, Gimli and Legolas meet Gandalf the White and thereupon depart for Edoras. Faramir leaves Minas Tirith on a mission in Ithilien.

name: Entmoot ends, Ents attack Isengard
description: Frodo reaches the end of the marshes. Gandalf reaches Edoras and heals Théoden. The Rohirrim ride westward toward Isengard. Second Battle at the Fords of Isen. Erkenbrand is driven back. In the afternoon the Entmoot ends. The Ents march toward Isengard and reach it at night.

name: Battle of Hornburg
description: Théoden withdraws to Helm's Deep. The Battle of the Hornburg begins. The Ents complete the destruction of Isengard.

name: Théoden and Gandalf ride to Isengard
description: Théoden and Gandalf ride from Helm's Deep to Isengard. Frodo reaches the slag-hills at the edge of the Desolation before the Morannon.

name: Conversation with Saruman
description: At midday Théoden arrives at Isengard. Conversation with Saruman at Orthanc. A Winged Nazgûl flies over the camp at Dol Baran. Gandalf sets out for Minas Tirith with Pippin. Frodo hides within sight of the Morannon and travels on at dusk.

name: Host of West departs, Dúnedain join
description: In the early hours the Dúnedain join Aragorn. Théoden rides from the Hornburg to Harrowdale. Aragorn departs later.

name: Frodo brought to Henneth Annûn
description: Frodo is brought by Faramir to Henneth Annûn. Aragorn reaches Dunharrow at nightfall.

name: Paths of the Dead
description: At daybreak Aragorn takes the Paths of the Dead; at midnight he reaches the Stone of Erech. Frodo leaves Henneth Annûn.

name: Gandalf reaches Minas Tirith, Darkness spreads
description: Gandalf reaches Minas Tirith. Faramir leaves Henneth Annûn. Aragorn departs from Erech and goes to Calembel. At dusk Frodo reaches the Morgul Road. Théoden's arrival at Dunharrow. Darkness flows from Mordor and spreads.

name: The Dawnless Day
description: The Dawnless Day. The Muster of Rohan: the Rohirrim leave Harrowdale. Faramir is rescued at the gates of Minas Tirith by Gandalf. Aragorn crosses the Ringló. An army from the garrisons at the Morannon occupies Cair Andros and penetrates into Anórien. Frodo leaves the Cross-roads behind and sees the sortie of the Morgul-host.

name: Gollum meets Shelob
description: Gollum meets Shelob but almost repents when he sees the sleeping Frodo. Denethor sends Faramir to Osgiliath. Aragorn reaches Linhir and enters Lebennin. East-Rohan is attacked from the north. First assault on Lórien.

name: Shelob's tunnel
description: Gollum leads Frodo into Shelob's tunnel. Faramir withdraws to the fortifications of the Causeway. Théoden camps under Min-Rimmon. Aragorn drives the enemy to Pelargir. The Ents defeat the invaders of Rohan.

name: Frodo captured at Cirith Ungol
description: Frodo is captured by the Orcs of Cirith Ungol. The Pelennor is taken. Faramir is wounded. Aragorn reaches Pelargir and captures the fleet. Théoden rides through the Drúadan Forest.

name: Sam finds Frodo
description: Samwise finds Frodo in the Tower of Cirith Ungol. Minas Tirith is besieged. Led by the Wild Men the Rohirrim reach the Grey Wood.

name: Battle of Pelennor Fields
description: In the hour before dawn the Witch-king breaks the Gate of the City. Denethor burns himself on a pyre. At the first cockcrow the horns of the Rohirrim sound. Battle of the Pelennor Fields. Théoden is slain. Aragorn raises Arwen's standard. The Lord of the Nazgûl falls. Frodo and Samwise make their way north along the Morgai. Battle under the trees in Mirkwood; Thranduil drives back Dol Guldur's forces. Second assault on Lórien.

name: The Last Debate
description: The Last Debate. Frodo looks from the Morgai over the Orc-camp to Mount Doom.

name: Battle of Dale
description: Battle of Dale. King Brand and King Dáin Ironfoot fall. Many Dwarves and Men seek refuge in the Erebor and are besieged. Shagrat brings Frodo's cloak, mail-shirt and sword to Barad-dûr.

name: Host of West leaves Minas Tirith
description: The Host of the West leaves Minas Tirith and marches eastward. Frodo sees the Isenmouthe but is surprised on the road from Durthang to Udûn by Orcs.

name: Host reaches Morgul Vale
description: The Host reaches the Morgul Vale. Frodo and Samwise escape and begin their journey on the road leading to the Dark Tower.

name: Journey to Mount Doom begins
description: The dreadful nightfall. Frodo and Samwise leave the road and wander southward to Mount Doom. Third assault on Lórien.

name: Host leaves Ithilien
description: The Host leaves Ithilien. Aragorn dismisses the faint-hearted from service. Frodo and Samwise throw away their armor.

name: Last journey to Mount Doom
description: Frodo and Samwise accomplish their last journey to the foot of Mount Doom. The Host camps in the Desolation before the Morannon.

name: Destruction of the Ring
description: The Host is encircled on the slag-hills. Frodo and Samwise reach the Sammath Naur. Gollum gets hold of the Ring and falls into the Cracks of Doom. Destruction of Barad-dûr and Sauron's passing.

name: Ring-bearers honored at Cormallen
description: Frodo and Sam awaken from unconsciousness. The Ring-bearers are honored on the Field of Cormallen.

name: Host camps before Minas Tirith
description: The Host reaches the Pelennor and camps before Minas Tirith.

name: Coronation of Elessar
description: Coronation of King Elessar. Arwen and Elrond depart from Rivendell for Gondor.

name: Éomer and Éowyn ride to Rohan
description: Éomer and Éowyn ride with Elrond's sons to Rohan.

name: Elrond and Arwen come to Lothlórien
description: Elrond and Arwen come to Lothlórien.

name: Aragorn finds White Tree sapling
description: Aragorn finds the sapling of the White Tree.

name: Arwen's escort leaves Lothlórien
description: Arwen's escort leaves Lothlórien.

name: Arwen comes to Minas Tirith
description: Arwen and her retinue come to Minas Tirith.

name: Wedding of Elessar and Arwen
description: King Elessar weds Arwen Undómiel.

name: Arwen gives Frodo her place
description: Arwen gives Frodo her place on the ship to the West.

name: Funeral escort departs
description: The funeral escort of King Théoden departs. With it are Aragorn and Arwen, Gandalf, the Hobbits, Legolas, Gimli, Celeborn and Galadriel, Elrond and his sons as well as the Princes of Dol Amroth and Ithilien.

name: Escort comes to Edoras
description: The escort comes to Edoras.

name: Burial of Théoden, marriage of Éowyn and Faramir
description: Burial of King Théoden. Marriage of Éowyn and Faramir.

name: Last farewell of Arwen and Elrond
description: With the exception of Faramir, Imrahil and Arwen the company rides on. Last farewell between Arwen and Elrond.

name: Treebeard releases Saruman
description: Treebeard releases Saruman and Wormtongue from Orthanc.

name: Company visits Glittering Caves
description: The company comes to Helm's Deep. Legolas and Gimli visit the Glittering Caves of Aglarond.

name: Learn of Saruman's release
description: They reach Isengard and learn of Saruman's release. Aragorn and his retinue turn back and the company moves on to Dunland.

name: Overtake Saruman
description: They overtake Saruman and Wormtongue.

name: Rest west of Moria
description: They rest west of the Mountains of Moria.

name: Celeborn and Galadriel farewell
description: Celeborn and Galadriel bid farewell, the others ride on to Imladris.

name: Company comes to Rivendell
description: They come to Imladris.

name: Bilbo's 129th birthday
description: Bilbo's 129th birthday.

name: Gandalf and Hobbits depart Rivendell
description: Gandalf and the Hobbits depart from Imladris.

name: Cross Ford of Bruinen
description: They cross the Ford of Bruinen. Frodo's wound pains him.

name: Return to Bree
description: At nightfall they come to Bree.

name: Gandalf visits Tom Bombadil
description: They leave Bree. Gandalf parts from the Hobbits to visit Tom Bombadil. In the evening the Hobbits reach the Bridge of Brandywine.

name: Arrest at Frogmorton
description: They are arrested at Frogmorton and move on under 'supervision' of the Shirriffs.

name: Call to resistance
description: They reach Bywater and call the Shire to resistance.

name: Battle of Bywater, Saruman's death
description: The Battle of Bywater. Saruman's death. Liberation of the Shire.

name: Frodo ill on Shelob anniversary
description: On the anniversary of his wounding by Shelob Frodo is ill.

name: Mallorn blooms
description: The mallorn on the Party Field blooms.

name: Sam and Rosie marry
description: Sam and Rosie marry.

name: Frodo resigns as Mayor
description: Frodo gives the office of Mayor back to Will Whitfoot.

name: Bilbo's 130th birthday
description: Bilbo's 130th birthday.

name: Frodo ill on Weathertop anniversary
description: Frodo is ill again (anniversary of his wounding on Amon Sûl).

name: Frodo ill again
description: Frodo is ill again.

name: Birth of Elanor, Fourth Age begins
description: Birth of Elanor, Sam's daughter. According to the Reckoning of Gondor the Fourth Age begins on this day.

name: Frodo and Sam depart to Grey Havens
description: Frodo and Sam depart from Hobbiton towards the Grey Havens.

name: Meet Elrond, Galadriel and Bilbo
description: At Woody End they meet Elrond, Galadriel and Bilbo.

name: Departure to the Undying Lands
description: They reach the Grey Havens, where Gandalf awaits them and a ship lies ready. At the last moment Merry and Pippin arrive to bid farewell. Bilbo and Frodo go aboard with Gandalf, Galadriel and Elrond and sail westward. The Third Age ends here officially.

name: Return to the Shire
description: Sam, Merry and Pippin return to the Shire.
